sources.name: HoneyDB stats
sources.note: Public monthly stats used to estimate event volumes and service mixes. Detailed per-session data requires API access.

sources.name: The Honeynet Project
sources.note: Community reports and research used to inform heuristics for detection resistance and policy adaptation latency.

derived_from: HoneyDB public stats + Honeynet literature (see sources)
assumptions: Baseline engagement duration represents a conservative median for low-interaction honeypots (e.g., SSH/HTTP): 5 minutes
Detection resistance is approximated from literature and typical low-interaction honeypot behavior
Policy adaptation latency baseline assumes manual or periodic policy updates (~3 minutes)
Resource overhead baseline is a small footprint (0.2 normalized score) for simple honeypots
Threat intel yield baseline is moderate (0.4) for networks capturing varied services
